intro: Centranthus calcitrapae, commonly known as the limestone centranthus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils, thriving in rocky or limestone-rich environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Centranthus calcitrapae is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes.
